node.title: Urgent U.N. meeting after attack on Ukraine nuclear power plant
node.description: U.S. Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield urged Russia not to send its troops "into an unjust war â€” or on a suicide mission against a nuclear power plant."
node.content: ["United Nations \u2013 The U.N. Security Council held an urgent meeting on Friday following the attack and fire at the\u00a0Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant\u00a0in Ukraine, which horrified world leaders.\u00a0", "The head of the International Atomic Energy Agency, Rafael Mariano Grossi, briefed the Council from a plane en route to Tehran, Iran, and\u00a0tweeted,\u00a0\"It is high time to stop an armed conflict from putting nuclear facilities at severe risk.\"", "U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. Linda Thomas-Greenfield called once again for Russia to get its troops out of Ukraine.\u00a0", "\"We call on you to respect your own troops enough not to send them into an unjust war \u2014 or on a\u00a0suicide mission\u00a0against a nuclear power plant,\" Thomas-Greenfield said.", "\"To my Russian counterpart: this council needs answers. We need to hear you say this won't happen again. We call on you to withdraw your troops and weaponry from Ukraine,\" she said.", "Ukraine's U.N. Ambassador Sergiy Kyslytsya warned of a deteriorating situation: \"It is not only Ukraine under Russian attack. It is Europe. It is the entire world. It is humanity. And finally, it is the future of the next generation.\"\u00a0", "\"The results of the aggression of Russia against Ukraine are possibly devastating for human health and the environment,\" France's Ambassador Nicolas de Riviere said.\u00a0", "The U.K.'s Ambassador Barbara Woodward reminded diplomats of the stakes, saying, \"This is the first time that a State has attacked a fueled and functioning nuclear power plant.\"\u00a0", "Russia's U.N. Ambassador Vassily Nebenzia dismissed the allegations, pointing a finger instead at provocations from \"Ukrainian nationalists.\"\u00a0", "The 15-nation Security Council is working on getting humanitarian aid to civilians in Ukraine, and has called another meeting for Monday.", "Pamela Falk is CBS News Foreign Affairs Analyst and an international lawyer, based at the United Nations."]
